title: The Big Bang Theory Will Stream on HBO Max, You Nerds
text:
Photo: Michael Yarish/CBS

Our whole universe was in a hot, dense state … and then HBO Max came and bought the streaming rights to The Big Bang Theory! More than a decade after its 2007 premiere, the CBS sitcom, which famously chronicles a group of smart pals who are bad at fake-eating, will finally be available to stream for the first time outside the constraints of the network: On, yes, HBO Max, a.k.a. the WarnerMedia platform that’s recently gobbled up Friends, Pretty Little Liars, and the full Doctor Who catalogue. (On top of commissioning a lot of original films and series. Meryl alert!) Per a press release, all 12 seasons and 279 episodes will be available to stream in the U.S. when the service launches in spring 2020. Additionally, if you love reruns, TBBT will continue to air on TBS until at least 2028. Get psyched, Nobel laureates!
description: “The Big Bang Theory” will be joining “Friends” on HBO Max. This is the first time the show will be streamable outside of CBS.
